name: StandaloneQuery
tooltip:
An OMT StandaloneQuery is comparable with a reusable-(parameterized)-ODT-query, but this query is responsible for his own graph-selection.
Under the hood, a reusable-query will be automaticly created and registrated under the name of the StandaloneQuery; so you can use it
in every ODT-query.

To use a standalone query from the command line, you can use the `@opp/omt-service` module which includes an `opp-omt` command
line interface.

base.tooltip: the input to (or starting point of) the run of the Query

params.tooltip:
A list of parameters for this StandaloneQuery. The value of each parameter has to be specified by the caller which could be
the omt command line tool

graphs.tooltip:
Defines which named graphs should be in scope during execution of the ODT-query "query" (defined in this StandaloneQuery).
GraphSelection has two sections; `live` and `edit`, but only `live` is supported/allowed. Named graphs cannot be changed but their
contents are kept up-to-date which means that changes by other users in the same named graph are propagated to the client.

prefixes.tooltip:
A dictionary with prefixes that will be used to resolve short iris in this StandaloneQuery. These prefixes are in addition to the ones
imported and defined at the document level. Each key is a short string which is the prefix and the value is the full iri which will
be used as a replacement for the prefix.

query.tooltip: ODT query that returns rdf literals or iris
